meanings.definition: Characteristic of rowdies; rough or disorderly in behavior.
meanings.sent1: The rowdyish group of kids was causing chaos in the park.
meanings.sent2: The rowdyish behavior at the party made it hard to hear conversations.
meanings.sent3: The rowdyish puppies were playfully knocking over everything in their path.
meanings.sent4: The rowdyish storm shook the windows with its fierce winds.
meanings.sent5: The rowdyish students were like a whirlwind of energy in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Tending to cause trouble or be disruptive in a noisy or boisterous way.
meanings.sent1: The rowdyish fans were shouting and cheering loudly at the game.
meanings.sent2: The rowdyish music from the party next door kept me up all night.
meanings.sent3: The rowdyish squirrels were chattering noisily in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The rowdyish traffic made it difficult to cross the street.
meanings.sent5: The rowdyish wind howled through the night, keeping everyone awake.
